headline: 59-Year-Old Retired Delivery Driver Robbed A Bank For $1 So He Could Get Medical Care In Jail — 'It Was Worth It. I Had No Other Direction to Go'
summary: It wasn't about the money. It wasn't about the thrill. It was about getting arrested—on purpose. James Verone, a 59-year-old retired Coca-Cola delivery driver from Gastonia, North Carolina, walked into a bank in 2011, handed the teller a note asking for $1, and calmly took a seat in the lobby to wait for the police. Why? Because he couldn't afford to see a doctor. Before the "heist," Verone reportedly mailed a letter to the local paper, the Gaston Gazette, explaining his plan. He had no job, no

headline: Coca-Cola FEMSA invests in Brazil factory
summary: The company will use the money to build two new production lines for soft drinks at the Mogi das Cruzes factory.
